description:
Great Shanghai Chinese Noodle House in the heart of the Richmond District.  The noodles are authentically fresh and with great texture.    My 2 personal favorites are #74 spicy ground beef and mushroom noodle and # 76 noodle with scallion and dry shrimp.

Must try!!!!   Great food, fast service, and super convenient location for pick-up.....  Usually double park in front of the driveway on the 2nd Avenue side.
author: Lawrence L.

description: I keep coming here as it's a convenient location for me. Good, consistent food, nice staff, clean bathrooms and generally clean restaurant. There are vegan choices too which make them unique
author: Regina G.

description: At first I was a bit overwhelmed by the amount of things on the menu but that is a me thing because I get to the point where I can't even decide. Things that were ordered and eaten with pure happiness: Steamed pork buns, shrimp fried rice, sweet and sour chicken and noodles with mussles. Everything tasted really good and came out really hot (no complaints with that). I laughed a little when the waitress asked me if I needed a fork since I may have been struggling a little with my chopsticks and the rice but I AM NO QUITTER. Service was quick and food was delicious.
author: Yochabel U.

description:
Was expecting simple Shanghainese food like picked veggies noodle soup etc, but surprisingly they've changed the menu, to maybe be more "mainstream" and including some Sichuan dishes? Anyway, what I was hoping to get as an appetizer, 香干馬蘭頭 (bean curd with ma-lan veggies), was not on the menu anymore. 

We ordered:
- Scallion oil noodles with dry shrimp (蔥油拌麵): supposed to be classic Shanghainese, a bit too much sauce, but the fried scallion was nice. Al dente noodles were nice. 
- Vegetable and pumpkin noodle soup: lots of veggies which was nice, but overall the flavor was a little off. 
- Wood ear and cucumber appetizer: not bad, not outstanding either. 

Overall, an OK restaurant, but nothing to write home about.
author: Wendy K.

description:
My bf has been telling me he wanted to take me here for the longest time and we finally got it on a Sunday for lunch. This places was not crowded nor empty, they seated us right away. The only thing was that they didn't give us the menu for another 5 mins when we asked. All the workers speak mandarin and it was a little hard to communicate sometimes.

We got the Beef, Clam and Tomato noodle soup. The noodles are sooo good! They were a nice slippery chewy noodle in a nice tomato soup. It's perfect for a cold day or if you're feeling sick. The noodles were not super heavy either, they were thin and easy to pick up. I think they make their own noodles too. I was very satisfied.

The Wontons in chili oil and peanut sauce were very good too. It was a simple dish that taste so flavorful and complex. You can see them cooking it from where I was sitting because the kitchen was pretty open for people to see.

I got a soy milk to drink that was supposed to be sweet, I saw them put regular sugar in it but it did not taste that good so I feel like it was not worth getting.

Overall I would definitely come here again and try all the other noodle soups as well!
author: Ada N.

description: Came here cause I miss Shanghainese food, and damn did it hit the spot.  I love Szechuan spicy stuff that I grew up eating in Flushing, NY. Can't seem to find too many of these restaurants around SF.  Had the spicy tripe, and it was soooo good. God I miss this cuisine.
author: Annie S.

description: These noodles taste amazing! Need an affordable and good lunch? The Noodle Soup is $4 for a large portion of noodles with yummy broth and some veggies. You can't beat the price and quality. I want to come back ASAP. Thank you! Also, the waiter is really sweet.
author: Vanessa S.

description: Clean and quiet atmosphere. The beef chowfun was really good and they give your large portions for a good price.
author: Ashley C.

description:
Nothing fancy, it's like an old taco diner, but there are enough good dishes to keep you satisfied. We saw the grand opening sign out front for many months(they really need to take that down), and decided to try it out. The food is inexpensive and the service is minimal. Our favorites dishes were the beef noodle soup and xiao Long bao.  The waitress recommended the beef noodle soup and she was spot on.  We both loved it and thought it was memorable.  It's like Taiwanese beef noodle with an extra kick.  The other dish we liked were the xiao Long bao, steamed dumplings with soup inside. They were small, but flavorful and easy to eat. 

On the side, I ordered the pork mooncake. It's basically a flavorful pork meatball wrapped in a crispy multilayered flour shell. 

Rating 0-5(best)
Ambiance:  2
Cleanliness: 4
Food:4
author: Duke D.

description:
Tip: although this place is really authentic but it is severely understaffed. Just one lady working at the front. So my suggestion is that know what you want before you go in to avoid a long wait. A table behind me is literally fighting among themselves because the grandma and the mom wants to cancel the order while the son and daughter wanna just be a bit more patient and wait for their food. 

they need to hire some more help front or they will loose a lot of repeat customers. We are here twice for the past two days and have seen many of customers left angry. 

I think this place is one of the selective few restaurants that does Chinese and American Chinese dishes right. When we came here for lunch the restaurant was pretty much full with half Chinese customer ordering some really authentic shanghainese dishes and other none Chinese customers ordering American Chinese dishes like beef broccoli over rice. 

Very tasty noodle dishes such as beef noodle soup and my fav noodle with scallion and dry shrimp( N25 this dish is dry, no soup). Some great appetizers as well, loved the smoked fish, bamboo shoot and you gotta try A17, bean curd with ma lan vegetables, very rare dish, hard to find. We also liked the house special pan fried pork bun, very delicious! 

I agree with some of the reviews that service can be slow since there is only one lady works at the front. She is very chatty to the point it might be annoying but I guess she needs someone to talk to since she is the only one working at the front. A great place to eat! We will be back for sure!
author: William C.

description: We're basically visiting tourists walking around after a fun time exploring Golden Gate Park.  We were hungry and using the GPS to help us find a decent place to eat.  Weirdly enough, some restaurants in the area were closed. After some time (and a few blocks) we spotted this cute restaurant and I'm truly thankful! I ordered the Beef satay soup which I ordered "mildly spicy". It came back with the perfect kick I was looking for--just enough, but not too much that it takes away from the flavor experience.  I loved the bok choy, the flavor of the broth and the noodles.  My First-Born had the beef tendons & it looked & tasted (according to him) very delicious.  Although I was very happy with my choice, I found myself having food envy & wanting his food choice. LOL! The Huz and my Youngest both had the Meatball Soup.  It included two gigantic flavorful meatballs.  They were very happy! The servers checked on us often and seemed like they really were aiming to please.  I wish them restaurant great success and recommend it to anyone looking for a delicious meal!
author: Maria E.

description: This place was close to toyota (I had to leave my car for an hour) and I decided to stop by for lunch. I'm so happy did! This place is super casual and comfortable. I ordered shanghai dumplings and the beef noodle soup. Dumplings were fantastic! Noodles were very delicious and I was happy I didn't order a spicy option because I added the chilies on my own and made it spicy enough. All in all I was happy. It was very filling (2 plates for just me) so I'm planning to bring my husband next time so that we can order more and share!
author: Pau Y Monica C.

description: Japanese ramens are so overrated. I like Chinese noodles because of the diversity! This noodle place is one of my favorite places to go around my neighborhood. The noodle soups are very hearty and decent. My favorite dishes on the menu are their meatball noodle soups and their braised chicken noodle soups. They are so simple, yet so good and hearty. For an appetizer, I usually order their kau-fu. It's basically a spongy tofu dish that has absorbed the flavor of the broth. I recommend this place if you are looking for an alternative to one-hour long line and $12 ramen places (ramens in Japan are supposed to be cheap and quick junk foods).
author: Jimmy B.

description: Best dim sum without the wait (at least for now!). Ordered the five spicy cold beef appetizer which was surprisingly delicious. The Chinese donuts dipped in warm soy milk was also the move. XLB had a gorgeous, juicy flavor and my fav of all time, the Za jiang mien / cha chiang mien / jja jang mien / jajangmyeon was soooo good. We should have ordered 2 of them. Chill place, and my Shanghai-nese boyf was excited about how legit this place was. So yay!!
author: Sarah S.

description: If Chinese food could be described as basic, this would be it. Ordered a beef noodle, non spicy soup ($11) and it was fine. There was an adequate amt of beef meat w/ fat. Noodles were thin and typical.  Broth was fine w/ a faint bit of spice. Service was friendly and food came out within 10 minutes.
author: Thomas L.

description: I believe all their noodles are handmade by the people there, or at least that's what they advertise. There are quite a few noodle soup options, my favorite being the House Special Beef Noodle Soup. Get the XLB if you are absolutely craving it and can't wait for another day, otherwise just skip it as it arrives sans the soup inside the dumplings- defeats the purpose of getting XLB. Not much more to say about this place, good option in the Inner Richmond if you're into the "hand made" trend and Northern Chinese cuisine.
author: Joyce Z.

description:
A low key noodle restaurant with surprisingly good food.

* * * EXPERIENCE * * *
Pros
- Conveniently located on Geary
- Not much waiting time
- Friendly staff

Cons: Nothing I can think of!

* * * FOOD * * *
Stewed beef, clam and tomato noodle soup: A-.
Tomato-based noodle soup sounds easy to make, but it's the easy stuff that often requires skills to master. The concentration of tomato in soup was right to the point. Beef was tender, and sizes of clams big. The combination of these three items is pretty unique and I really enjoyed it.

There are some other special items on the menu, will definitely go back again and try those out!
author: Simon C.

description:
I ordered the beef stew noodle soup and got exactly what I expected.

Price and quality were about average. 

Unfortunately, nothing really stood out and I feel like the quality was the same everywhere. 

I would go again since it wasn't bad but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.
author: Chris L.

description: This place is fantastic. Every dish came out amazing. The ladies at the front were wonderful and super attentive. Overall great experience and glad I visited
author: Steve S.

description:
[Update] Been back a few more times and the food is consistently good. Keep it up Gourmet Noodle House!
-----
This place serves Shanghainese style noodle, although they do offer some fusion options. 

I've tried it 3 times so far and their noodles are consistently good. I really like the texture of their noodles. The soup can be on the salty side though.

I also like how they take credit card for most orders. Convenience and recognizing that's just how people prefer to pay earns them an extra star.
author: Joseph L.

description:
The Kimchi noodle soup is fantastic!!! Spicy and fantastic!!! 
They took us in right as they were closing-  and so glad they did!   We'll be back!
author: Aaron R.

description: I was a little worried about quality since there were so many options, but I was pleasantly surprised.  The soup dumplings were pretty good, the beef noodle soup was just right in texture of noodles and flavor of broth, the chow fun was delicious.  I've been twice and so far the only thing I didn't completely like was one of their dumplings (has a peanut sauce) because the peanut flavor was a little overpowering; it'd be better if it was just chili oil based without peanut.  But service is great and so are portions.
author: Kara M.

description: I can't believe I found this place a few weeks ago! The place seems very comfortable, not too much decor.I really love Shanghainese food and this is one of the best restaurants ever. I been here only one time but the second time, I ordered this spicy glazed chicken wings and WHOA THIS IS GOOD! The skin of the chicken is very crispy, the sauce is not too spicy or sweet. I ordered other foods and they also tasted great. My opinion is order the spicy chicken wings, they are a must!!!
author: Carrie L.

description: The rating is solely for the service because they didn't even give me the chance to try their food. Came here for lunch on a Saturday and there weren't much people yet. We weren't that hungry so we only ordered some Shanghai dumplings and a noodle soup. We sat there for almost 30 minutes with no water or utensils. During this time, there were more people who came in. My daughter was getting thirsty and hungry from all the waiting, so I finally decide to ask them for some water and about our food. They told us our food is coming after dropping off ONE cup of water. Another 15-20 minutes passed and other tables who came in after us all got their food already! We had to leave because my three year old was VERY hungry by this time. Honestly, if you guys didn't want to serve us because we only ordered two items...then say something about it since the beginning! Don't make my three year old wait and wait!
author: Ariel J.

description:
I came here with my parents and sister for dinner one night around 7 and the restaurant was pretty empty. However within a few minutes the place was full! 

We ordered the lion head meatball soup noodle, the beef flank soup noodle, the Shanghai rice cake, black bean noodles, and Shanghai dumplings. The meatball itself was really good, very soft and flavorful, however the broth was very bland. The soup for the beef noodles was really good, not overly spicy. My only complaint is that they are stingy on the veggies. One bok Choy per soup? Lol. The rice cakes were average, nothing special. The dumplings were pretty good except the vinegar they give isn't the usual brown or red but is just white vinegar. My favorite was the black bean noodles, it tasted just like the one from the Korean grocery store.
author: Linz C.

description: The restaurant looked really authentic. Therefore, I ordered a tomato beef soup. It was quite disappointing as the soup tasted like tomato pasta sauce and there was a bug inside the soup.
author: Jin Y.

description: The food here is okay. The chef is definitely heavy handed with the salt and oil (I had the beef chow mein). The services is not great. The server sat on her phone the whole time not paying any attention as to what was going on in the dining area. There are definitely better places to eat in the area.
author: Asa H.

description:
Below average to me.

I ordered the shanghai spare rib noodle and panfried dumplings.

Spare rib is very soft but tasted lack of seasoning. I liked the noodle itself, it's chewy and thick.

Their dumplings tasted like the prepackaged frozen one. Nothing is really noticeable.
author: Natasha L.

description: Authentic shanghainese items but somehow the umami flavor is not quite there.  Very decent price.  Good decorations too
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
I had the house spicy beef flank noodle soup and it was below average. The soup lacked flavor and actually was not spicy at all. My friend & I both had to add a bunch of chili oil to the soup to make it even remotely spicy to our liking. 

However, I would recommend the soup steamed dumpling! They came out a few minutes after our noodle soup, but they definitely were the highlight of the meal. The dumplings had the perfect amount of soup & the spoons were big enough to hold them!
author: Elizabeth W.

description: This is the worst place I have ever been in this country. If you want to go to a place that the server let you sit down while the table was still dirty and she FORCED you to order something and at the end forced you again to give more tips, this place is your best choice. I have never seen someone who is so rude and greedy. The food is so so, but definitely won't make up to the bad service, the bad feeling will ruin your whole day!
author: Xiaoxiao Z.

description: Authentic shanghainese comfort food! They had it all, it was all delicious. I highly recommend the 5 spice sliced beef, tastes just like what my grandma made! From the shanghainese rice cakes, to the Beijing zha jiang mien, and then the XLBs. I felt like I was back in Shanghai.
author: Colin H.

description:
I liked this place. My family's from near shanghai and i've been missing the food. I got the lions head meatball noodles, and enjoyed it! It was surprisingly simple, with a really fresh, light broth and some bokchoy on top (i wish more noodle places did bokchoy....for some reason it's a shanghainese thing.) It was what I wanted but next time I think I'm gonna try a more flavorful soup.

I also got the smoked fish appetizer which was delicious too!

Service was sooo quick, vibe was genuine, and Ill definitely go back again.
author: Michelle L.

description: Excuse me?? The waitress is the way too cool from the beginning...doesn't ask you if you need a drink, then doesn't refill the water, and doesn't bring you a napkin...‍ and I really don't understand why she asked me to share one teapot with other customer who's not even sits next to me???!
author: Yoyo V.

description:
very authentic shanghai style noodle and dumpling, super nice service. Food is served fast. Clean and neat indoor decoration.
The wuhan sesame noodle, pan fried pork buns,  lion head meat ball noodle, house special beef flank    noodle is a must try!
author: Junfei H.

description: Relatively rude staff. Food is mediocre at best but also very affordable. It was incredibly slow for a Saturday night which was nice and they accommodated for a large group. Grand Opening sign has been up for months.
author: Carla C.

description:
Terrible service! The food is fine, nothing special. But oh my god the server/owner is awful. She is terribly pushy and rude. She tries to force you to order what she wants, not what you order. And at the end of the meal, she literally *begs* for tips. 
I could never go here again, she's just too horrible.
author: Jack F.

description: Service is terrible. Tables that came after us got menus, water, ate then left. Meat was SUPER salty, even after washing it in my wife's chicken broth. Soup had too much Star of Anise in it.
author: Anthony T.

description:
I have gone here 3 times to get seafood noodle soup. Excellent  broth, perfect temperature and an abundance of mussels clams and shrimp.  Large bowl
With excellent spicing.  Also tried calamari which was good but not spectacular.   Dumplings were fresh and meaty, highly recommended.   Will return for a quick dinner.  They may benefit from an expanded drink list not too expensive.
author: Lamb C.

description:
I ordered Eel Noodle Soup, stewed beef tomato and clam with noodle soup, and fried special pan fried pork pun. 
The eel noodle was surprised to be offered here. The taste is good, but it would be better if there are more veggies and other seafood added in.
However the funny thing is that the waitress doesn't know how to split the bill she even say the payment is not indivisible.
author: Xin T.

description:
Noodles are delicious!  Your order will take a few minutes to be prepared and it WILL taste uber fresh.  The noodles are obviously handmade and melt in your mouth.  Broths are tasty and meat/veggies are plentiful. 

It's a casual place with casual prices- $8-$12 for most entrees with complementary green tea, 

Check it out!
author: Cassandra C.

description: New Menu ，the food is delicious，the service is good ，I will come back to try other noodle soup
author: Sunny Y.

description:
No soup in xlb... Even though the flavor is good.
Shanghai noodles... Whole uses quality ingredients.  Taste is bland.

Pickled veggie and pork noodle soup was the best thing I had here.

Great quality, reasonable prices... But a bit bland.
author: David H.

description:
Love this place! It's a local spot that my roommates and I frequently get take out from. Favorite orders are:

- Fried pork buns
- Clam and tomato beef noodle soup
- Lion's head meatball soup 

If you're looking for a something warm during the SF winters (or foggy summers in the richmond) this will hit the spot!
author: Tiffany H.

description:
Pretty good.

Pork chops are nice, good noodle portions.

Service is great too, food came fast even though it was about to close.
author: Bill Z.

description:
Tasty noodle option. Shanghai style food. 

Tried three dishes tonight:

1) spicy five spice soup noodle. The noodles were tender but still toothsome. Really nice actually. The soup was similar to hot and sour soup; just spicy enough but not numbingly so. There was a a bit of pork, bamboo and black woods ear in the soup, also similar to hot and sour soup. Good option.

2) combo Shanghai chow mein. Most restaurants call this dish Shanghai style thick noodle. The noodle was thick but not super thick. There were chunks of shrimp, chicken, pork and beef. Some cabbage and spinach also. Nice flavor and the balance of tastes was really good. 

3) chicken and corn dumpling. This was just OK. I have a suspicion they probably purchase these from one of the dumpling producers in the Richmond. It was ok, not outstanding.

Overall a nice little noodle place, the prices are pretty reasonable. Bill for the above was $27. Not bad; will be back to try out some other dishes.
author: Dom L.

description: The food is tasty, NOT greasy nor salty, and the price is very reasonable.   Tried the shredded tofu and greens salad; steamed crab and pork dumplings; and pumpkin with noodles soup.    All were very good.  The waitresses are welcoming, attentive and made some good recommendations.   Definitely coming back.
author: Mikey T.

description: For some reason the health isn't shown but if you search for it on the SF health Dept database you'll see that it's only 78. Several moderate violations. I'm in public health and won't eat anywhere with a score under 80.
author: R. P.

description: Good food.  Loved the Five spice pork noodles.  The noodles were a very good texture and flavor.  Not really a fan of their Shanghai dumplings, they were small and there wasn't any soup juice inside.  On the other hand, the Pan fried dumplings are better.
author: Karen L.

description: Good noodle shop. Owner was friendly and the noodles were good. Ordered the beef flank soup and five spices noodle soup. Soup was flavorful but a bit oily. A good place to stop by for a bite.
author: Joe M.

description:
My go-to for fast noodle takeout! Love the noodles here - relatively cheap and very delicious! I've eaten in once and I enjoyed that as well. Nice ambience and overall a pleasant experience. 

My favorite noodle dish here is the tomato beef and clam noodle soup. Lots of rich flavors, not too skimpy on the meat and clams, and a huge amount of noodles! The pan fried pork buns are also a dish you've gotta try. I also like the black bean paste noodles (Korean style "jajangmyun") and they also have champpong here! Love it because I often have cravings for those Korean-Chinese noodle dishes :) the lion head noodle soup is good as well, but the broth is a bit on the salty end. Good meatballs though!
author: Grace D.

description:
Gourmet Noodle House is Shanghaiese eats. menu goes beyond the usual lion head meatball, xiao long bao, shanghai noodles.....

eats: Special Yellow Croaker w/noodle(10.25)
-salty broth with croaker fillets, sliced bamboo tip, button mushrooms, fermented snow cabbage?, and a small amount of noodles.
*saltiness comes from snow cabbage. fish tasted fresh, probably freshly thawed. croaker native to china.
-noodle looked/tasted ala dried noodles. could be freshly made in house.

leftovers:
-no service after getting soup
-was presented with a 2nd bowl when i was waiting for check
told "server", "not mine".
-pricey? no msg tasted, sodium yes.
-2 flatscreens, unusual for a shanghai eatery, leftover from bbq/burrito eatery?
-4 stars for unique shanghai eats, saves me a trip to shanghai to authenticate 
 food.eatery part of chain popular in china?
author: Victor G.

description: Dude, the spicy beef noodles are amazing. Just barely not too spicy and full of flavor. We grabbed ours to go but the sweetest lady took our order. She barely spoke English but helped us navigate the menu and ultimately recommended the dish we ended up ordering. Will definitely stop by this place again next time we're in the mood for noodles and broth.
author: Charles S.

description:
Came for dinner and tried a variety of bowl noodles with orders of XLB and sheng jian bao. The XLB was juiceless! But the meat had good flavor - a bit on the gingery side and very succulent. The sheng jian bao are smaller than normal...but they were pretty good. They were neither doughy nor too meaty. It was definitely a perfect balance.

As for our bowl noodles, we tried the Yellow Croaker Noodles, Lion Head Noodles, and Shanghai Wonton Noodles. All were delicious and hearty, but my favorite was the Lion Head Noodles. The noodles were cooked just right and the lionhead meatballs were very good. They were stewed just right, ensuring the meat was not gummy/mushy nor too tough.
author: Elaine Y.

description: I tried this place Twice! 1st time was a wonton noodle soup to go - it was soso. 2nd time a spicy dumpling dish that wasn't spicy at all and a $8+ shanghai salted chicken that looked old and non-appetizing sad lookin chicken. $8 is Overpriced for chicken had barely any meat, tastes old, and gave a very small amount of mainly skin and bones. I eat out all the time and price is not an issue but i will never order anything else from besides the dumplings. Everything else is just overpriced for the small amount they give you and how old the meat is = not fresh!
author: Ele K.

description: Food is good here, but service sucks, we have 4 people , waitress put down a tea pot with 2 cups ???????   Asked 4 times for 2 more cups......  asked 3 times for 3 glasses of ice water, also took da wrong order (already pointed out the dish name to her on the menu, still incorrect ).  To be honest the food is good, but when I kinda enjoying my food, I heard some nail clipping sounds, when I turn around, I saw the same waitress were clipping her nails at the cashier register area - right in front of the kitchen door, omfg she did all 10 of her fingers.....   glad that she was doing it after all my food are out, can't imagine what if her nail fell into my food.  So gross and nasty, will not come back again with these type of service and acting from the waitresses.  To be fair 2 stars definitely for the taste of the food.
author: Cora L.

description: On Sunday, it was freezing outside and I was pleasantly surprised to find that the restaurant turned on their heater. It's not a very cozy restaurant so heat and hot tea made the experience better. The service was good and they were friendly and the servers spoke both Mandarin and Cantonese. The dishes came out fast and fresh. We liked reading over their menu because it had a few dishes we don't typically see on menus of other Shanghai restaurants such as Marinated Egg, Soybean in Wine Sauce, Eel Noodle Soup and Smoked Fish but we weren't in the mood to try something new today. We went with the usuals: Shanghai Steamed Dumplings (Xiao Long Bao), Chive, Shrimp & Pork Dumplings, Spicy Wonton, Ji Vegetable & Pork Rice Cake (new to us), and Garlic Spinach. The Xiao Long Bao and dumplings were really good. We liked the tasty broth in the Xiao Long Bao and there were big pieces of shrimp in the dumplings. We didn't care for the spicy wonton though. The peanut sauce on the wonton was bland and not spicy. The rice cakes were different than the regular Shanghai style ones because the vegetable was something we hadn't had before and we really liked the flavor. We loved the Sesame Pancake stuffed with green onions. They have dessert options too so we tried the Black Glutinous Rice Pudding. It's not pudding but is a sticky black rice dish stuffed with red bean paste. I've never had or seen anything like it before and it was ok. I wouldn't order it again but it wasn't bad. I just expected an actual pudding. We'll try this place again for their other menu options.
author: Jen L.

description:
Gourmet Noodle House is either an outpost or a knockoff of a popular Shanghai chain of the same name (identical graphics and text in both Chinese and English on the sign). It doesn't matter which to me, as it's the first real Shanghai-style "mian guan" (noodle house) I've encountered n SF. Think of it as a Chinese counterpart to a ramen house, and order a bowl of noodles and a small side dish or two to flesh out (or veg out) your meal. The noodles are all made (though not hand-pulled) in house, as they would be in any respectable Shanghai noodle joint, as are the xiao long bao.

I highly recommend the yellowfish noodles (N4 on the menu), an excellent version of what has become a classic Shanghai noodle dish. The server will warn you of the possibility of small bones in your soup, as it's almost impossible to de-bone a yellow croaker of all its fine bones, but I found no bones in mine. I also lucked out with my choice of fried tofu as an appetizer. It had a pile of crispy on the outside and soft on the inside cubes of tofu interlaced with slices of jalapenos and onions, a bargain at $3.95.

On my first visit I checked out the house-make xiao long bao (because it was there) and the savory soy milk soup (xian doujiang, which oddly appeared under "drinks" on the menu). Both were respectable though not great, though they aren't the point here. Noodles are.
author: Gary S.

description:
DO NOT GO HERE!!!!!!
I have to make a complaint about the waitress---Service was very rude and sucks!!! Foods are inedible!!! My friend feels dizzy after she drinks tea!!! 
THE WORSE RESTAURANT IN SAN FRANCISCO!!!
author: Jenny Z.

description:
15.12.13   FIRST time
                 Raw Review
                 2nd day of opening

Food ----------------------------- 3 - 3 1/2 Stars
Service -------------------------- No comment your highness
                                             Gotha be fair
Décor ---------------------------- Ok

Used to be Roadside BBQ
THEN
New ownership as
GS Roadside BBQ made a switch
Twice as Fajita joint then
Fusion Mexican

It looks like new ownership.
Gourmet Noodles and some loose items.
45 main + small dishes + side of rice

A4    Fried Calamari
         Shoestring sized cut
         Slivered Onions all deep fried
         Too thin for me ... resulting less tender calamari

N15  Shanghai Style Wonton (10)    $7.95
         Ok

N22  House Special Shanghai Steamed Dumpling (10)  $8.95
         Should eat whole
         Don't puncture the skin
         Juicy
author: S.K. Y.

description: Pretty mediocre place for shanghai style food. I came in for a quick lunch with coworker which wasn't quick at all since the service was quite slow (there was only one waitress). I ordered the five spice pork noodle soup. The menu says it is spicy but I couldn't really feel the heat at all. Overall, the soup was pretty flavorful and the noodles were overcooked a bit (soggy). There was bamboo and that was the only part I truly liked.
author: Emily L.

description:
Stopped by because of the "Grand Opening" sign. The menu is similar to the most Shanghainenese restaurants. Good selection of noodles. Decent portions. Affordable prices. Reasonable amount of time to have food on the table.

We ordered: 

(1) House Special Shangahi Steamed Dumpling (Xiao Long Bao, N29) - I'm always looking for a good place for xiao long bao, but here, the flavor was lacking and a few of the dumplings I had, had barely any soup in them. I guess Din Tai Feng still holds its reputation for the best xiao long bao.

(2) Stewed Beef, Tomato and Clam with Noodle Soup (N4) - My older son chose this and it's quite appetizing. The broth was rich in flavor fresh tomatoes and clams. 

(3) Fried Beef with Black Pepper Sauce and Noodle (N24) - A bit on the bland side, this dish really has not much to offer. I've had better. Skip it as there are many selections here.

(4) House Special Beef Flank Noodle Soup (Spicy, N11) - this is pretty good. Beef Flank was very tender and broth was flavorful. Noodles were fresh pulled ones which gave the chewy texture. Could have been a bit more generous with their beef flanks. 

(5) Shrimp and Chive Dumpling (S2) - we had to cancel this one because there was NO SHRIMP in the dumpling at all. Why would they name it Shrimp and Chive dumpling if there were no shrimp in it? I brought it to their attention and the waitress told us that's the way it is. Well, glad she was willing to cancel the order. 

Stop on by if you are looking for some Chinese comfort food other than dim sum.
author: Em T.

description: It's ok,  it really was not the place for us, but my oldest boy really like the place!
author: Jeff K.

description:
I like the noodle there,
we liked stewed beef, tomato & clam with noodle soup, since the noodles tasted super fresh.
even though that was super busy there, the waitress still explained us with patient. the waitress told us the noodle is home-made noodles.
author: Huimin C.

description:
Bland food and terrible service . Came here for two different noodle soup and the pan fried dumplings. Lions head soup and dumplings didn't have much flavor. The other soup just tested like chili sauce. 

Above all, I'm appalled by the service. While the waitress was cleaning up our table, she threw one of the bowls into my bowl full of hot soup. Not surprisingly, a lot of soup splashed onto me and my personal belongings. I asked for some towels and she came back with ONE single napkin which took her a few minutes to bring to me. Unacceptable. 

Never coming back again.
author: Chelsea Y.

description:
Not too hot. Had their famous xiao long bao and pork and chive dumplings. Both were bland in taste and had skins that were very thick. It seemed like steamed potstickers than dumplings. The wrapping/skin is supposed to be thin. There seemed be no chives in the dumpling? It was only a miniscule portion that could be found? Your supposed to be able to taste the chive, not just the pork.
 Pricing was a little high. Doubt I'll come back for the noodles that I've seen reviews for. Don't feel it will be worth it or taste good. Portions did look big...
 Will stick to my other dumpling shops that are better.
author: V. P.

description: Good day for hot noodles and had a good time with my little ones they treated us nice and the Shanghai dumplings are awesome!!!
author: Azikiwee A.

description:
Came here for a quick lunch on Saturday afternoon. Ordered the pork and cabbage noodle dish. Small amount of pork and cabbage. Enough noodles to take home for another meal.  The whole dish was salty, too much soy sauce.  

Friendly service. The food was just not good enough to make another trip back.  There are plenty of other good noodle place in the Geary area.
author: Cynthia L.

description: horrible experience. I went for an non rush hour time, the server wasn't efficient. I wasn't got served water after I asked multiple times. The food I ordered wasn't tasted fresh, I felt the beef has gone bad already. I ordered just two dishes, and I couldn't believe they messed up my order as well. They served the dish I ordered to another table. By the end I didn't get what I ordered and the quality of the food is super poor. Never come back again.
author: Yan Z.

description:
I had high hopes for this place esp after going to San Dong on the same block for lunch and being pleasantly surprised.  I tried to like this place (would always welcome the opportunity to frequent another Shanghainese restaurant) but a second visit is just never going to happen. 

Unlike most Chinese restaurants, the service was shockingly good but the quality of both the ingredients and cooking was poor.  Most of the beef flank in the noodle soup was not edible as it consisted mostly of chewy gristly tendon that even curls.  The allegedly handpulled noodles were too perfect and did not resemble homemade noodles.  I had never (until today) felt pork inside Shanghainese dumplings (xiao long baos) were of bad quality because it's usually fatty juicy meat anyways, but it was obvious that the meat quality was very poor when the meat made crunchy sounds.  I think the straw that broke the camel's back was the watered down black vinegar that accompanied the xiao long baos--who does that??!!  A really cheap Chinese restaurant willing to sacrifice quality--that's who!

The lion's head meatballs were very soft and tender but not flavorful; I just knew the meat quality was poor after eating the other two dishes so I did not feel the need to finish the dish (my kids, on the other hand, did finish the meatballs but they are not picky).  We had to send the garlic spinach back since it was SOOOO salty and greasy--it was the FIRST time I didn't feel right feeding my kids veggies!

I was surprised by the decent Yelp reviews but I'm thinking the other reviewers are not very discriminatory.
author: Marina S.

description: I've been here twice. For lunch one afternoon it was really full. Our food still came out fast I ordered the vegetarian soup and it was really tasty but missing MEAT. The next time I went I got #14 on their menu and it was very good but a little salty. Would definitely come back next time I crave noodles, the price is right
author: Carmel G.

description:
Any soup can be ordered dry - with lo mein.  
N14 is my fave on a dark and stormy night... steamy hot and spicy to clear my sinus and hot enough to warm me inside out.  House Special Beef Flank Noodle Soup.
author: Geri S.

description:
First thing I needed was the restroom. If the restrooms are clean then I have to assume the food would be good. 
We were greeted as we entered the restaurant. She was very courteous and friendly. She gave us some time to review the menu and finally took our order. 
So far so good. 
Again, I have to assume the food is good. 
I will review the meal after we settle down to eat.
Okay!
The meal was very, very good. It is very tasty and memorable after you have taste it. 
We recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants a light meal. 
We love it and will return to this place when we are near or around the neighborhood.
author: Edward W.

description: I wanted to order the pork chop with soup but they didnt have it. I then tried to order ji cai rice cakes with pork but they didn't have it. They tried to tell me the she tou was the same thing as the pork chop with soup which I know is a lie. Finally I said I would just have an order of sheng qian bao. She hard pressed me to order something else. I had to tell her three times that I only wanted the sheng qian bao. It was very uncomfortable. The waitress did not bring me the water I ordered after 20 minutes even though there was only one other customer. I came up to the counter to order a side of noodle soup and to ask about the water. She refused to sell me the noodle soup. She said I wouldnt like it as it has no taste and after kept trying to up sell me to a more expensive soup. After refusing to let me order three times I told her forget about it you can just cancel my order. Worst service I have ever encountered. I will not be returning.
author: Anthony R.

description: beware,overpriced foods with tiny portion. IN MY OPINION, the noodles are so blend and no flavor at all.
author: Tao S.

description:
I will admit i was sad to see the prior owner vacate this resturant, as i am a fan of bbq. However i was pleasantly  surprised to find this noodle house is a solid addition to my lunchtime repertoire. 

I ordered the pork with bamboo noodles, and my lunch companion ordered the pickled veggies with pork and noodles. Both were big bowls with fresh made noodles  and a tasty pork broth. No additions necessary which is always a huge thumbs up in my estimation. 

The Shanghai dumplings of pork and cabbage were a touch bland but thus is a noodle house so im willing to forgive. As a plus the broth wasnt oily or too heavily seasoned in any particular flavor. It was in fact a great melding of Shanghai flavors.

I will certainly  be returning for more noodles.
author: Kira G.

description: Pretty darn tasty noodles. I will be back to try other noodle dishes. Friendly and fast service!
author: E F.

description:
Did not expect much from this place since the ownership and cuisines of this building has been changed up so many times. My hubby and I gave it a try on a cold night, so the hot tea hit the spot once we settled in (which they charge for, btw). I ordered the kung pao chicken noodle soup on a whim ($9) - kung pao chicken is something I never order, but I never saw it in form of a noodle soup so I was intrigued. Suffice to say, it was delicious! Plenty of chicken and loved the texture of their noodles (very smooth and perfect thickness). Portion was good as I couldn't finish it. My husband order a chow mein dish that I thought tasted generic and a bit oily. He really liked it though. 

We came here a second time and shared the beef flank noodle soup ($11). The broth was tasty - a bit spicy but nothing you can't handle. This time we tried their homemade shanghai dumplings ($10) and pan fried pork buns ($9). The pork meat in both dishes were good; you can taste the quality and freshness. I view it as a bit expensive, though, because we were still a bit hungry after our meal.
author: Mei H.

description: Shanghai dumpling is good and the texture of their noodles are good too. But look, the grease from the noodle dish can make me another egg over easy
author: Mandy W.

description: The house special beef flank noodle soup was delicious! Will definitely come back soon!
author: Evan C.

description: It's the best Shanghai noodle I have taken in America！ Too delicious！ The taste of hometown.
author: Yuan A.

description:
I never write reviews but I felt the need to write this time.
I've been to this restaurant on several occasions and it just seems the service and the food get worse and worse with each visit.
Today was the worst. Tried the zhajiangmian and it was so bland, I asked (actually my husband who is chinese asked for me)for a little extra black bean paste to liven it up. First the waitress was outraged that we even asked. She then went into the kitchen and we could hear them talking about it...its as if we asked for their first born!
She then proceeds to come out with a little bowl of soy sauce(!?!) because the owner stated "I cannot give you more paste because the recipe calls for that certain amount"

....are you serious!?!

My advice is find another recipe and a better attitude!
author: Aracelis G.

description: I don't love everything on their menu, however their Shanghai Special Dumplings are very authentic.  I was in Shanghai last year and the Gourmet Noodle House does a great job with these little morsels that melt in your mouth.  I love them. Pair them with some garlic green beans and you have a nice light and tasty meal.
author: Michael D.

description: Awwwwwesome place. Really quick and nice service. The tomato/beef/clam noodle soup was delicious!!!
author: Kelly A.

description:
ordered the tomato noodle soup with beef
the noodle texture is good but the soup was very sweet and the beef was very chewy.  i didnt try anything else... xlb?  next time i can write a review for that?
author: Moto B.

description: I came here with my family on a Saturday night. Although it was very busy, the waitress was very attentive. The food was great and the soup dumplings were legit. Definitely give the salted chicken and salted duck a try!! I will be a returning customer for sure.
author: Connie N.

description: soup noodles are amazing, fresh croaker tastes as same as in Shanghai. I bring raw XiaoLongBao home and cook 10min thoroughly, and好吃到感人。 taste so goood.
author: Hazelnut Y.

description: The mooncake is authentic but hardly found fried shrimp in the shrimp n green onion oil noodles.
author: Hantien W.

description:
Giving this place 5* for the taste and quality relative to the prices. We came here on a Friday night and ordered 

-N15. Consomme Vegetable Noodle Soup with pumpkin soup ($8.25)
-N29. House Special Shanghai Steamed Dumplings ($9.95)

The xiao long bao were respectable, but the consomme vegetable noodle soup is what will keep us coming back! The pumpkin soup was DELICIOUS and had plentiful vegetables and flavor - one order was enough for almost two people (we shared and fought over who got the last slurp) :). We would have happily paid 1.5x the price for this quantity and quality of yumminess. 

Will definitely be back to re-order this and try other noodle dishes!
author: Diana C.

description: Delicious food, friendly staff and very affordable. I think the location may be cursed, but if anybody deserves to survive here, it's these folks!
author: Gabriel E.

description: Good hearty food. Noodles are of a slightly chewy texture - just right. Dumplings are a bit too doughy but I can definitely recommend the beef noodles.
author: Rebecca C.

description: We saw this new restaurant while driving by and decided to check it out. It features Shanghai dishes like those you would find in a small eatery in China. I loved the yellow croaker noodle; the broth was very flavorful. The xiao long bao was well made as well. The smoked fish was good but had lots of bones in it, which could be annoying if you are used to fish fillets.
author: Kimberly F.

description: Bought some noodle dishes, not a lot of meat or vegetables given. It's mostly noodle and soup for $10.
author: Robert S.

description: Such good food!! This was the best calamari I've ever had and my boyfriend and I make it a point to try the calamari at EVERY restaurant that serves it. I had the wonton soup with noodles and added bok choy. It was delicious and really hit the spot. The decor is simple but classy and the food is portioned very generously. I loved slurping broth out of the ladle-like wooden spoon that comes with the serving bowl sized soup. No, really, it's meant to be one serving. On a chilly July day this was the perfect remedy.
author: Louisa S.

description: Come for the noodle, it's quite chewy, hope you're a fan of Shanghai nostalgia cuz that's what the decor is all about.
author: Sydney L.

description: Delicious neighborhood spot. Very friendly staff. Great prices. I had the Shanghai dumplings and beef so m, both yummy. Highly recommend supporting this place!
author: Daniel P.

description: we ordered the shredded pork and Chinese mustard soup noodle, it was very oily.  The appetizer chinese veggies with minced tofu was drenched in oil and way too salty, not authentic at all.     The resturant has a strong smell when you first walk in.   I would not go back there again.
author: Lucy J.

description: Love this place! Everything is delicious! I especially like the noodles with black been paste sauce, but I haven't found anything I wouldn't order again. And it's not expensive.
author: Cary R.

description: As a noodle lover, the noodle soups here won't let you down. I ordered The eight delicacies spicy noodle soup. It was a little bit sweet for me, but overall it was tasty. My friend ordered the beef shank spicy (Sichuan spicy) noodle soup which was very good too. I will definitely come back to try other noodle soups.
author: Vera L.

description:
Drove by and saw this restaurant.  I love Shanghai food so gave it a try.  I first ordered the smoke fish, that was 7pm, as the appetizer and the clay pot wonton as the entree. First, the waitress came back and told me they were out of the smoked fish so I changed the appetizer to the deep fried yellow fish.  The kitchen confirmed that they had the yellow fish.  I waited for 20 minutes and the wonton arrived but without the yellow fish.  It is just a typical Chinese restaurant which does not know the meaning of service.  I waited for another 3 minutes and the yellow fish did not come so I had to start to eat the wonton before it is getting too cold. 
The wonton broth was basically water.  It did not have any salt, bland and just slightly warmer than the room temperature. Inside the clay pot, there were 6 tiny wonton but not even one single piece of vegetable.  The wontons were so small, I could eat two at once.  The whole wonton clay plot does not even have more than $1 of ingredients within.
By the time I finished the wonton, the yellow fish was still not there.  I waited for another minute and gave up.  I walked up to the cashier and told her I want the check and canceled the yellow fish.  She charged me the yellow fish because they had made it already.  I argue with the cashier that the yellow fish was an appetizer, not a dessert.  She said they were busy.  I said that is not an excuse if you run a business.  She refused not to charge me.  I gave my dish to the guy who was waiting for his take out order.  I can't believe what a stupid waitress and the thrifty owner.  I will never go back there.  
Do not order the Clay Pot Wonton.  There are so many better Chinese restaurants in SF than this one.
author: Benu P.

description: Do not go here. They skimp on the ingredients . I ordered the high end tomato noodle soup. Had 3 pieces of meat 3 clams, 4 pieces of tomato's and just so little noodle. Expensive price too. Over 10 bucks for something so little. Soup was good. But I'm not ordering soup. Service good but food is just too expensive.
author: Harry L.

description: They have a new chef and things have gotten great here again! They have without a doubt the best xiao long bao steamed dumplings I've ever had outside Shanghai. Also get the spicy pork noodles (#19) and the newly-added Shanghai noodles, #30. Both Fantastic!
author: John P.

description: I guess it's ok. Seems to have people in there daily. But what concerns me is the people sleeping in the restaurant for the hours between lunch and dinner service. That grosses me out.
author: s b.

description: Pretty horrible service.  This is my third time trying it out and every single time I come here it takes about 20 to 25min to take an order.  I'm done trying this place or at least giving them a chance.  Food might be decent but the service is ridiculous.  Just be aware
author: Jin K.

description:
for a new place, you'd expect super service and great attitude. but unfortunately, not really. we were the only ones at the door, stood there for 5 mins and no one acknowledged us while they walked back and forth without looking at us. we were about to leave when the older lady asks how many.  waited another 5 mins for the table they asked us to wait to leave.  we sit but then she thought maybe we should wait for the smaller table.  we were not waiting longer when there's an empty table already.  no one came in behind us..

note to restaurants, if there are customers, just sit them when you have a table. does it make a difference if we sit in a smaller table or big, we are paying you for the service, why give us a bad impression. 

since we didn't move, we then get an attitude.  since we sat, we ordered but honestly we should have left.  we had to ask for every little thing. can we have a plate, can we get a spoon.  it was ridiculous.  

the food was ok. for the price, you'd expect to be full. no.  so no, we will not be back.
author: Silver C.

description: My bf and I passed by this place several times and decided to try this place out for the first time. We were immediately greeted by a friendly waitress who can speak Mandarin, Cantonese and English. We ordered shanghai salted chicken (4/5),  shanghai dumplings (4/5), house special noodle soup with beef flanks (3/5), and lion head meatball noodle soup (5/5). We both like the lion head meatball noodle soup! The meatballs (you get 2 pieces only) are well-seasoned and the soup is somewhat bland, but they go so well together. The home-made noodle itself is fresh and chewy. Highly recommend you to order the lion head noodle soup. The dumplings are juicy, but the skin is too thick.  The house special noodle soup was too spicy for me to finish it all and the beef flanks were a bit overcooked which made it hard to chew. I would definitely go back for more lion head meatballs noodle soup.
author: Cindy W.

description: Need a bit more noodles in their soup noodle. We like the lion head meat ball soup. And the twice cooked pork is good.   The dumplings aren't that good.  A little pricey for what you get i think. Clean and good service though.
author: CR L.

description: The 'Shanghai style fish' appetizer and the 'lion head meatball noodle soup' are my usuals here.  They're quite good.  I would stay away from their dishes involving clams or other seafood as those are not guaranteed to be fresh (like the 'beef, tomato clam noodle soup'...you will want to spit the clams out and fort/unfort there are only like 4 of them in the soup dish).  Overall the flavors are authentic Chinese so I do rank this among the top chinese restaurants I'd like to frequent in the neighborhood.
author: Evelyn H.

description: Good food, friendly service, glad we stopped in for lunch.  The king pao noodle bowl was very tasty, as we're the pork dumplings!
author: V T.

description: I'd say this place is just above average to the others in the area. The food can be hit or miss but most things I've had were tasty. The service can be lackluster. I placed an online order for pickup, then when I walked in 20 min later, judging from the look on their faces/the discussions they promptly had, it was obvious they had forgotten my order. Tell me, what's the point of ordering in advance if you're going to forget my order and make me wait there anyway?
author: Eric H.

description: This is probably the best place for Chinese style soup noodles in the Richmond district. Got the beef shank noodle soup and sheng jian bao - both were very tasty. The sheng jian bao was served Shanghaineae style and was very well done.
author: Christel C.
